arm_group.description: 15-item list of suggested interventions aiming to reduce DNT sent to SITS-WATCH centers.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control group (non SITS-WATCH centers in SITS registry)
arm_group.description: Centres that do not use 15-item list of suggested interventions aiming to reduce DNT.

brief_summary.textblock:
In patients with acute ischemic stroke: the sooner the thrombolysis treatment is
      administered after symptom onset - the better the outcome. This delay can be dissected into
      onset-to-door time and door-to-needle time (DNT). SITS-WATCH aims to reduce median DNT in
      participating centres.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reduction of In-hospital Delays in Stroke Thrombolysis: SITS-WATCH

detailed_description.textblock:
In patients with acute ischemic stroke: the sooner the thrombolysis treatment is
      administered after symptom onset - the better the outcome. This delay can be dissected into
      onset-to-door time and door-to-needle time (DNT). Of the two, DNT can be directly influenced
      within the hospital by stream-lining of acute stroke care. The aim of our study is to reduce
      in-hospital delays (DNT) in self-selecting centers recruiting patients into the the  Safe
      Implementation of Treatments in Stroke-International Stroke Thrombolysis Register
      (SITS-ISTR) , comprising currently more than 80 000 patients from 1338 centers. Current
      median of DNT in all SITS centers is 65 minutes (compared with 20 minutes in Helsinki
      Univer-sity Central Hospital). An itemized detailed questionnaire, including all factors
      known to influence DNT, has been sent to all SITS centers to identify the reasons for long
      in-hospital delays. Based on the replies, we have prepared a list of interventions that can
      be considered by individual SITS centers in order to reduce DNT with interventions that are
      in line with national legislation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All consecutive patients with acute ischemic stroke registered in SITS registry.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Centers not inputing patient data into SITS registry. Patients with missing DNT data.

intervention.description: 15-item list of suggested interventions aiming to reduce DNT sent to SITS-WATCH centers.

clinical_study.keyword: inhospital delays, door-to-needle time, thrombolysis, acute ischemic stroke, SITS, SITS-WATCH, stroke registry
clinical_study.official_title: Reduction of In-hospital Delays in Stroke Thrombolysis: SITS-WATCH

primary_outcome.description: DNT will be evaluated at regular intervals (twice a year).
primary_outcome.measure: Absolute DNT reduction of at least 20 minutes or at least 20% change in SITS-WATCH centers that completed the whole study period

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of centers with median DNT below 40 minutes. At least 3 new interventions implemented. Percentage of implemented interventions.
secondary_outcome.measure: Significantly larger reduction of DNT in SITS-WATCH centers compared with non-SITS-WATCH centers in SITS.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
